intro: Convolvulus oenotherae, commonly known as the evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and showy yellow or orange flowers that open in the late afternoon. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields.
